line=62 tag=T+DB:  sive is formed from ditransitive verbs in Dutch,                             "He is sent the book."

line=512 tag=G:            but  I have             then   FOC-PRT         have I         then   three times
line=513 tag=B:

line=515 tag=G:             short after each other        ]   have I then        against    Van Dam

line=520 tag=T:             `But I did fight against Van Dam in those days, three times shortly after one

doc_id=2753 igt_id=igt2753-1 136 158 L B L B L B L B L B B B T B T B T B T B T B M+AC
language: Dutch (nld)
line=136 tag=L:  (1)    IJje Wijkstra was timmerman en klompenmaker, hij stroopte, was op zijn vrijheid
line=137 tag=B:
line=138 tag=L:  gesteld en had een hekel aan autoriteit. Maar voor IJje hield de wereld niet op bij de
line=139 tag=B:
line=140 tag=L:  harde strijd om het dagelijkse bestaan. Hij las boeken over spiritisme en occultisme,
line=141 tag=B:
line=142 tag=L:  waagde zich aan Hegel en Nietzsche en moet zelf een boek hebben geschreven,
line=143 tag=B:
line=144 tag=L:  `Dualisme van het Heelal', al is het manuscript daarvan nooit gevonden.
line=145 tag=B:
line=146 tag=B:                                                                                            4
line=147 tag=B:
line=148 tag=T:  "IJje Wijkstra was a carpenter and maker of wooden shoes, he was a poacher, loved his
line=149 tag=B:
line=150 tag=T:  freedom and hated authority. But for IJje the world did not end with the harsh struggle for
line=151 tag=B:
line=152 tag=T:  daily survival. He read books about spiritualism and the occult, dared to tackle Hegel and
line=153 tag=B:
line=154 tag=T:  Nietzsche and allegedly wrote a book himself, called `Dualism of the Universe', but the
line=155 tag=B:
line=156 tag=T:  manuscript has never been found."
line=157 tag=B:
line=158 tag=M+AC:                                              Dagblad van het Noorden, February 11, 2003

line=3992 tag=M:                                                                                          Per washed clothes and Ola.
line=3993 tag=L:          en zal alleen stoppen te Assen

line=3998 tag=T+CR:          and wil l only stop in Assen.'

language: Dutch (nld)
line=636 tag=L:  (34)   a.     ik geloof niet dat ook maar iemand me kent
line=637 tag=B:
line=638 tag=M:  15        The ban on licensing polar-heel inside the CP complement of a neg-raising verb was also noted in the
line=639 tag=M:  unpublished notes on polar-heel by Teun Hoekstra, Jenny Doetjes and Johan Rooryck. They do not mention the role
line=640 tag=M:  played by clause union, however. I forewarn the reader that there is a way of lifting the ban on licensing polar-heel in
line=641 tag=M:  CP complements: parasitic licensing is possible in such a context. I will address parasitism in a separate section
line=642 tag=M:  (section 3), first establishing the `pure', direct licensing pattern.
line=643 tag=B:
line=644 tag=M:  Marcel den Dikken -- A polar whole

line=1619 tag=L:  (79)     a.        waarom is die (*hele) vent tot president gekozen?
line=1620 tag=B:
line=1621 tag=M:  31        There may well be an `A­not­A' operator (cf. Huang 1982) in the C­domain; but that operator will not help
line=1622 tag=M:  to license polar- heel via direct licensing: as I argued above, direct licensing of polar-heel is strictly dependent on Neg,
line=1623 tag=M:  not on just anything negative. Lee (1994) assumes that there is a NegP present in the syntax of rhetorical questions,
line=1624 tag=M:  but this assumption cannot be maintained, as Den Dikken & Giannakidou (to appear) point out: the negative answer
line=1625 tag=M:  of rhetorical questions is presupposed, not asserted.
line=1626 tag=B:
line=1627 tag=M:  Marcel den Dikken -- A polar whole
line=1628 tag=B:
line=1629 tag=B:
line=1630 tag=G:                     why is that whole bloke to president elected
